messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using Go (Golang) and the Gin (github.com/gin-gonic/gin) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. I'm now focusing on endpoint `/api/users` with method POST, and here is the relevant information I found:

1. In `users/routers.go`, `UsersRegistration` is implemented to process HTTP requests to `/api/users` with HTTP method POST.

I'll provide you with the contents of the files mentioned above, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project, and your task is to generate a list of Parameter Objects (the value of paths.[endpoint].[method].parameters) in Swagger 2.0 format.

You need to think step by step and provide an explanation of your results first. Then, output exactly "the final generated result begins", followed by the list of Parameter Objects in JSON format. Do not include fields not mentioned above, and do not use references ($ref) in your output (try to obtain the structure by executing additional Unix commands).

I will inspect the repository structure and search for related model and validator definitions to confirm the exact fields used for the user registration endpoint. This helps ensure the Swagger parameter schema matches the actual request payload. I will run a few targeted shell commands to gather this information.

{'stdout': 'total 172
drwxr-xr-x 6 user user  4096 Jan  1  1970 .
drwxr-xr-x 3 user user  4096 Dec 25 14:55 ..
drwxr-xr-x 2 user user  4096 Jan  1  1970 articles
-rw-r--r-- 1 user user   346 Jan  1  1970 BACKEND_INSTRUCTIONS.md
drwxr-xr-x 2 user user  4096 Jan  1  1970 common
-rw-r--r-- 1 user user   299 Jan  1  1970 doc.go
-rw-r--r-- 1 user user 16475 Jan  1  1970 FRONTEND_INSTRUCTIONS.md
-rw-r--r-- 1 user user   290 Jan  1  1970 .gitignore
-rw-r--r-- 1 user user  1464 Jan  1  1970 go.mod
-rw-r--r-- 1 user user  1627 Jan  1  1970 go.mod-generated_by_mod_init
-rw-r--r-- 1 user user 16959 Jan  1  1970 go.sum
-rw-r--r-- 1 user user  1619 Jan  1  1970 hello.go
-rw-r--r-- 1 user user  1068 Jan  1  1970 LICENSE
-rw-r--r-- 1 user user 65586 Jan  1  1970 logo.png
-rw-r--r-- 1 user user   900 Jan  1  1970 MOBILE_INSTRUCTIONS.md
-rw-r--r-- 1 user user  2412 Jan  1  1970 readme.md
drwxr-xr-x 2 user user  4096 Jan  1  1970 scripts
-rw-r--r-- 1 user user   434 Jan  1  1970 .travis.yml
drwxr-xr-x 2 user user  4096 Jan  1  1970 users
total 56
drwxr-xr-x 2 user user  4096 Jan  1  1970 .
drwxr-xr-x 6 user user  4096 Jan  1  1970 ..
-rw-r--r-- 1 user user   268 Jan  1  1970 doc.go
-rw-r--r-- 1 user user  2006 Jan  1  1970 middlewares.go
-rw-r--r-- 1 user user  4903 Jan  1  1970 models.go
-rw-r--r-- 1 user user  4153 Jan  1  1970 routers.go
-rw-r--r-- 1 user user  1379 Jan  1  1970 serializers.go
-rw-r--r-- 1 user user 13935 Jan  1  1970 unit_test.go
-rw-r--r-- 1 user user  2845 Jan  1  1970 validators.go
', 'stderr': "grep: invalid option -- 'S'
Usage: grep [OPTION]... PATTERNS [FILE]...
Try 'grep --help' for more information.
"}

Now that I have the relevant file content, I will identify how the POST /api/users request is structured. It uses UsersRegistration which binds a user model via NewUserModelValidator(). I need to inspect validators.go and models.go and serializers.go to extract the request payload fields required for user creation. I will fetch those files to determine the exact fields and their JSON names used for binding.

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.
